instructions: This is Nexora - an AI-native terminal application built in Go. Focus on production-grade code quality, test coverage, and adherence to documented patterns. This is math and science work - measure results scientifically, not subjectively.

rules.rule: All exported functions, types, and constants must have doc comments starting with the name
Use testify/require for assertions, never assert. All tests must call t.Parallel() unless they modify global state
Error wrapping must use fmt.Errorf with %w verb to preserve error chains
Context must be first parameter in all functions that accept it. Never use context.Background() except in main() or tests
NEVER create markdown documentation files unless explicitly requested. Update existing docs instead
Tool implementations must follow the pattern in internal/agent/tools/ with proper permission checks
Database migrations must be idempotent with IF NOT EXISTS clauses. Never modify existing migrations
All bash commands must go through safety blockers defined in internal/shell/shell.go
TMUX sessions must be managed via TmuxManager. Never create raw tmux commands
Provider implementations must match catwalk.Provider interface and be injected via injectCustomProviders

other.content: Sacred Rules: (1) Never guess - read files before answering, (2) Never create files unless necessary - prefer editing existing, (3) Never claim 'done' without validation, (4) Never suppress warnings, (5) Never touch production without approval, (6) Never commit secrets
Validation workflow: go build ./... && go vet ./... must pass. Mark complete ONLY when validation passes with actual output shown
Testing hierarchy: Unit â†’ Integration â†’ Module â†’ E2E â†’ User Journey. Test coverage target: 50%+
